extendedIngredients.name: bell peppers
extendedIngredients.originalString: 4 Bell Peppers of various colors, cored and sliced into strips

extendedIngredients.name: coconut aminos
extendedIngredients.originalString: ¼ cup of Coconut Aminos (or Soy Sauce)

extendedIngredients.name: duck fat
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 Tablespoon of Cooking Fat (coconut oil or lard)

extendedIngredients.name: skirt steak
extendedIngredients.originalString: 2 lbs of Grassfed Ribeye or Skirt Steak

recipes.title: Adobo Peppered Steak

winePairing.pairingText: Steak works really well with Merlot, Cabernet Sauvignon, and Pinot Noir. After all, beef and red wine are a classic combination. Generally, leaner steaks go well with light or medium-bodied reds, such as pinot noir or merlot, while fattier steaks can handle a bold red, such as cabernet sauvingnon. One wine you could try is Rombauer Merlot. It has 4.8 out of 5 stars and a bottle costs about 26 dollars.

productMatches.title: Rombauer Merlot
productMatches.description: Enticing and lively red color; beautifully aromatic with black cherry and ripe plum. On the palate a purity of blackcurrant, cedar and mint flavors blend together seamlessly. Soft and supple, this wine has a medium-bodied mouth-feel with plush tannins that integrate with the generous finish.Our favorite pairings for this wine include chicken parmesan, cedar-planked salmon over wild rice, and mushroom pizza.

recipes.instructions: Slice the meat into thin strips about 3 inches long.Heat a wok or stir fry pan to medium and add cooking fat.Add the onions and sliced meat and cook for about a minute.Add the garlic and continue cooking until meat edges are brown.Add the coconut aminos, vinegar, bay leaves, salt, pepper, and enough water to cover the meat. About 1 cups of water.Boil for about 25-30 minutes uncovered, with occasional stirring, until meat is tender and sauce is reduced.Add the sliced bell peppers and stir fry until peppers are cooked, about 3 minutes.Adjust seasoning to taste and enjoy!

steps.step: Slice the meat into thin strips about 3 inches long.
Heat a wok or stir fry pan to medium and add cooking fat.
Add the onions and sliced meat and cook for about a minute.
Add the garlic and continue cooking until meat edges are brown.

Add the coconut aminos, vinegar, bay leaves, salt, pepper, and enough water to cover the meat. About 1 cups of water.Boil for about 25-30 minutes uncovered, with occasional stirring, until meat is tender and sauce is reduced.
Add the sliced bell peppers and stir fry until peppers are cooked, about 3 minutes.Adjust seasoning to taste and enjoy!
